title: Assistant Manager
description:
The Role:At Freebird, product and people are the heartbeat of our story and the “sole” of our brand. Creating beautiful, unique boots laid the foundation to that story but the feet inside our boots built the journey. Freebird employees reject the norms of an ordinary customer experience and pride ourselves on building deep and genuine relationships with our customers. Those relationships have always been at the forefront of everything we do and is the reason why we are so excited to rapidly expand our store footprint throughout the U.S. As we experience hyper growth, we are looking for career driven individuals that are as obsessed with creating an exceptional customer experience as we are.
Beyond building beautiful stores we will be hiring teams of unique and diverse individuals that represent our brand and our mission in each region. These teams will be a part of shaping the voice and character associated with the Freebird name. These individuals will have the opportunity to career climb in a quickly growing company that puts people and product above all else.
The ideal candidate will be passionate, self-driven, and a highly organized individual with a desire to make a difference in people’s lives. Additionally, they will be confident, creative, bright, friendly, helpful, detail-oriented, and able to consistently perform at the highest level. Candidates must be well spoken and confident in their ability to interact with strangers, as well as be able to remain calm and organized at all times.
Responsibilities:Leadership and Team DevelopmentContribute to a positive work environment that all employees are excited to come into, be challenged by, and contribute toBe a proactive and solution-based contributorCreate and contribute to an environment where knowledge is being passed down successfully and feedback is welcomedLead by example, implement and uphold Freebird’s standards amongst your peers and StylistsNetwork/recruit within our four walls and in the communityOwnership of Stylists daily development and coaching “in the moment”Ensure all employees understand company policiesMaintain a strong understanding of team/personal development (strengths/weaknesses, responsibilities)
Customer ExperienceExemplify, create, and uphold a positive and unique customer experience, ensuring all team members can successfully execute the Freebird experienceActively manage training of all Stylists on the customer experienceMake every customer interaction memorable and unique to their individual needsContinually build a clientele base and develop relationships in your communityHave your finger on the pulse of your sales floor and take ownership of all customer interactionsBuild a strong knowledge of our Company story, product line, brand aesthetic, and philosophy to effectively teach and inspire our team and customers
Operations/Inventory ManagementAnalyze business trends and have a strong understanding of store numbers, best sellers, KPI’s and put that knowledge to workMaintain knowledge of stock room capacity and keep inventory neatly organized within itMeet cleanliness standards on a daily/weekly/monthly basisEnsure all operational policies and systems are being met daily
Visual MerchandisingTrack best sellers and inventory weeklyKnow when new shipment is coming and having a plan for where new shipment will be merchandisedManage and teach company standards for all product styled on the floorEnsure all store inventory is merchandised on the sales floorFollow company merchandising guidance
Business PlanningMonitor business trends to work with Store Director ahead of time, to guarantee the team is staffed properly to drive businessContinuously assess business performance through reports and sales data to create action plans to improve results for the storeLearn the importance of planning and thinking through making the schedulesRelay critical business events/information to team membersDrive business results by maximizing daily sales goals, setting challenging goals for your team and recognize exceptional performance
 Requirements:2+ years relevant customer service experience in a fast paced, challenging, and creative customer facing environmentHigh School diploma requiredBachelor’s degree in business or related field preferredExcellent organizational, verbal and written communication skillsAble to work flexible schedules including nights, weekends and holidays
For more information or to apply directly please visit our Careers Page:https://www.freebirdstores.com/pages/careers

title: Budget Analyst
description:
Sealing Technologies, a Parsons Company, provides cybersecurity services and cutting-edge technologies to the Federal Government. Sealing Tech is looking for a Budget Analyst III to join the team!. The Budget Analyst will report to the Finance Manager and oversee dashboard creation, maintenance, and reporting. This is a great opportunity for a career-focused candidate to join a rapidly growing company and a supportive team that will offer challenging assignments and growth opportunities.
Roles & Responsibilities:
BudgetingAssist with annual financial planning, and monthly forecasting process.Review project and task level forecasts monthly, provide feedback and troubleshooting support to program managers.Analyze COGS in forecast model and collaborate with the team to fix and verify the correct projections.Interpret and present financial analysis of monthly and quarterly results versus plan and prior year.Support creation of, required reports and ad-hoc reporting as needed by various mission areas.
Dashboard Setup, Reporting, & MaintenanceDevelop and manage Unanet dashboards for interactive reporting on company and Mission Area performance and KPIs.Collaborate with internal stakeholders to develop, implement, communicate, deliver, and interpret KPIs as leading indicators on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis.Continuously analyze, evaluate and refine KPIs to align with organizational goals and objectives.Preparation of ad hoc analysis based on a variety of data sources including sales transactions, accounting ledgers, costs of production, trade statistics, and other economic data.Work with large-scale datasets, utilizing excel, Unanet Analytics, and similar tools for data extraction, analysis, and reporting.Analyzes processes to identify the flow of data and gaps in data; develops new ways to obtain data.Provide quarterly and monthly reporting as required by our parent company.Other relevant tasks are assigned by the Finance Manager.
Minimum Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree required, preferably in Accounting or Finance.4-6 years of budgeting experience; government contracting experience required.Background working with different government contract types such as FFP, T&M, and CPFF.Strong analytical and data analytics skills.Familiar with multiple reporting tools including Excel and Unanet.Strong expertise in crafting intuitive and interactive reports and dashboards using Excel, PowerBI, or a similar tool.Ability to work in a small team with a highly collaborative manner to meet required deadlines and perform all necessary tasks.“Hands-on” professional with a strong attention to detail and organizational skills.

**This role has an internal job title of Budget Analyst III**.Salary Range: $64K-$80K and potential to qualify for bonuses. The anticipated base salary range for this position based on current national data. Minimums and maximums may vary based on location. Actual pay will be adjusted based on an individual's skills, experience, education, and other job-related factors permitted by law.
Working is no longer solely about the job. Here at Sealing Tech, we understand your happiness and health is vital to our success. We are innovative in our approach to cultivating balanced work environments and offer a plethora of added perks. Sealing Tech offers competitive compensation packages, health, dental, and vision insurance, retirement contributions, continuing education budgets, tuition reimbursement, flexible schedules, and generous vacation policies. Other perks include complimentary snacks, drinks & monthly catered lunches, and company retreats and gatherings. Plus, flexible work arrangements, pet friendly offices and quarterly merit bonuses for qualified employees. We are looking for a new member to join our team, take on challenges, be innovative and willing to grow with us. BUILD, SECURE, SOLVE.

title: Quality Engineer
description:
Akkodis is hiring an Onsite Quality/ Validation Engineer for a client in the Medical Device Manufacturing industry located in Bloomington, IN. You will serve as the lead quality representative of certain product lines within product development, manufacturing, post-market surveillance, and/or CAPA. Must have's experience: Validation, remediation, NPI. 
Pay: $60.71 per hour.Onsite: Bloomington, IN
Job responsibilities include:• Perform work per external and internal quality standards. Adhere to the Quality Management System and its processes to meet FDA 21 CFR 820, ISO 13485, and other applicable regulatory requirements. Provide leadership in the understanding of medical device regulations and best practices.• Interface with internal and external groups on quality-related issues. Must work and interact effectively and professionally with and for others throughout various levels of the global organization. Must have effective communication skills and ability to work in a collaborative and independent work situations and environments with minimal supervision.• Support product development and transfer to manufacturing.• Facilitate development and implementation of production controls. (e.g., qualification, process capability, sampling plans, DOE reviews, validation reviews, technical writing etc.)• Perform investigation of product non-conformance/complaints, root cause analysis, monitoring/trending of process and product, and escalation of identified issues. Validation execution. Thorough review of technical documents.• Plan, review, and approve change requests.• Execute risk assessment as needed and facilitate development and completion of risk file documentation. Conduct Risk-based decision making and effective resolution of issues.• Lead or support CAPAs as necessary.• May interface with internal or 3rd party audits. (e.g., FDA, Notified Body, etc.)• Drive continuous improvement efforts through facilitating, leading, and collaborating with cross function teams including quality, engineering, production, clinical, and regulatory affairs.• Manage conflict resolution as it relates to technical situations.• Must maintain all training requirements for the position, while seeking out opportunities for continuous development and growth.

QUALIFICATIONS:• Bachelor’s degree: Mechanical or Biomedical Engineering• 3-5 years of experience process and equipment validation and TMV in a regulated manufacturing environment position. Packaging or sterile barrier experience a plus.• Demonstrates knowledge of medical device regulation (ISO 13485, 21CFR) and risk management (ISO 14971)• Professional certification (e.g., ASQ, Six Sigma, etc.) preferred.• Proficiency in statistical, quality, and continuous improvement methods and tools.• Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite of products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook) is required.• Strong organizational skills.• Critical thinking and attention to detail required.• Excellent verbal communication skills and technical writing.• Ability to remain calm and receptive in fast paced situations.
If you are interested in this Onsite Quality/ Validation Engineer position in Bloomington, IN then please click APPLY NOW.

title: Manufacturing Engineer Supervisor - 3rd shift
description:
Manufacturing Engineer Supervisor 

3rd shift

Location: Hanover, PA

About SKF

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! 

SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. SKF bearings played an integral role in helping Mars Rover collect rock and regolith samples on the planet’s surface.

As an SKF team member, you will join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. Sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030. 

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

Job Summary

The Aerospace Business Unit is responsible for Aerospace applications with a global responsibility for Sales, Manufacturing, Business development, Product and Process Development. The Business Unit operates in a large number of countries and markets, all over the world and with a customer portfolio that includes all major players in the Aerospace industry. Our business is fully customer focused, with products specifically designed for an engine / airframe application and then produced in small quantities and small lots on highly flexible equipment. Extreme product range fragmentation, complex product design, very high-quality standards and traceability requirements are the peculiarity of our Business Unit. In Hanover, PA we produce Rings and Seals for the Aerospace and Industrial markets.

To manage, analyze, assist with engineering needs and facilitate production activities on 3rd shift.To lead 3rd shift production employees.Work with employees to constantly improve efficiencies. Independently analyzes product and equipment specifications and performance Day-to-day meeting of the production goals while maintaining both Quality and Safety standards.

Responsibilities

Coordinate with Operations Manager for resource analysis and capacity planning.Plan and assign work according to changing priorities.Motivate machine operators to accomplish production goals.Initiate SKF Production System to improve product flow. Train, mentor and supervise the machine operators for continued improvement of skills and development of human capital.Perform defect root cause analysis and mitigation.Perform product margin analyses.Independently analyzes product and equipment specifications and performance requirements to determine product characteristics which can be produced by existing manufacturing or processing equipment and methods. Provides technical information concerning manufacturing or processing techniques, materials, properties, and process advantages and limitations which affect long range plant and product engineering planning. Maintains an above average knowledge of the in-house manufacturing process in order to provide the goal of reducing total costs.Knowledgeable of machine controls and able to make offset adjustments.Participate in capital equipment selection decisions and justification.Perform departmental administrative duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in engineering, programming, or related field preferred.Associate’s degree in engineering, programming, or related field required. Minimum of 3-years supervisory experience in manufacturing setting.Experience in managing and inspiring direct reports.Union experience preferred.CNC controls and programming experience required.Due to the nature of work, US Citizenship is required.Ability to train on 1st shift.Home shift for position after training will be 3rd shift (11P-7A, with a Sunday night start up).Some Saturday work will be required due to business needs.Shift flexibility to assist department for coverage due to paid time off.

Skills, Knowledge & Other Requirements

Experience in manufacturing very tight tolerance parts with thin cross-sections.Strong oral and written communication skills and high confidence in providing recommendations.Must have an inquisitive nature to understand how factory processes impact results to effect change.Ability to work collaboratively with all levels of employees.Ability to deliver effective feedback, both written and verbal.Experience working with exotic materials.Experience in implementing and applying Lean manufacturing techniques in an Aerospace manufacturing setting. Formal Lean training a plus. Experience in prioritizing and managing multiple projects simultaneously, meeting production goals within time and budgetary constraints.Experience in developing human capital through selection, teaching, training & mentoring.Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.Ability to clearly communicate at all levels within the organization, both written & verbally.Honesty and strong work ethic.Flexible, problem-solving, positive mind-set.A passion for the work. Permitted to work in U.S.

What You’ll Love About SKF

Rest and Relaxation. Enjoy a generous PTO policy and 13 paid holidays.

Work/Life Integration. SKF supports work/life integration, home, family, community, personal well-being and health. Flexible work options available, depending on role.

Diversity in the Workplace.?At SKF, we strive to embed Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in everything we do. By developing a culture of belonging, our people can flourish; leading to an inclusive, equitable environment that promotes leadership, engagement and innovation.

Best in Class Benefits. SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. Comprehensive healthcare options to fit your needs and opt out payment. Added benefits include company paid life insurance, STD, LTD. Supplemental benefits include critical illness coverage, tuition reimbursement, employee discount programs, and much more!

Invest in your Future. Participate in our 401K program that boasts a 10% employer contribution: 100% match up to 5% of your elected contribution (100% Vested) plus an additional 5% company contribution.

Reports to: Operations and Manufacturing Engineering Manager

Location: Hanover, PA

Job ID: 19659

SKF provides equal employment [and affirmative action] opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

title: Aftermarket Technical Sales Manager

SKF has been making the world spin since 1907!

SKF bearings, made in Muskegon, played an integral role in helping Mars Rover collect rock and regolith samples on the planet’s surface.

As an SKF team member, you will join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. This position is responsible for engaging SKF Authorized Distributors, Channel Partners, and End Users with a focus deepening and expanding the customer relationship. In this position, you will be expected to deliver consistent year-over-year sustainable profit growth within the assigned portfolio of business. This will be accomplished by driving sales growth through product expansion, REP business, relationship building, and flawless customer experience.

Proactively document sales opportunities in C4C based sales funnel that align with SKF defined strategies of product expansion, REP offers, and existing customer account management.Actively manage C4C sales funnel for growth and retention opportunities with potential to grow the business.Maintain and establish technical contacts to generate opportunities in the defined sales area.Develops and execute cross-functional go-to-market (GTM) strategy with internal and external stakeholders.Strong customer account management practices. Successfully manage end customers with opportunity-based sales plan designed to protect existing businesses and expand product sales.Drive REP business.Employ Sales Excellence process in offer development and insight presentations to move opportunities through the sales funnel.Plan and modify products to meet customer needs.Secure growth and retention orders.Ensure timely delivery.

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent industry experience.Strong commercial and technical/mechanical aptitude.General industry knowledge with strong ability to communicate technical details.Ability to succeed within SKF Sales Excellence process and insight selling knowledge.Provide training and hands-on demonstrations of bearings, seals, and maintenance products.Knowledge of lubrication methods and practices including performing assessments and providing recommendations.Knowledge of bearing failures and causes; providing hands-on failure analysis and recommendations.Ability to troubleshoot applications and articulate advanced problems to Application Engineers as needed.Ability to inspect bearings and conclude to scrap, reuse or rework.Strong situational awareness; adept at managing complex organizations and situations.Effectively utilize SKF technology/tools – C4C, Illuminate, Microsoft Suite, PTPlace, DeliveryData.net, SKFiOS, Android Applications and Crooresus.Proficient knowledge in sales plan development/execution, funnel management, external/internal customer follow up.Strong knowledge of distributor management – profit and loss statements, margin and mark ups, competitive rebates, returns, shipping and logistics, terms and conditions, digital transactions (EDI, PTPlace, portals, etc.).Exceptional organizational, time management and sales planning skills.Purposeful action taker with strong ability to make sound judgements and good business sense.Entrepreneurial spirit; self-motivated and driven to win.Eagerness to constantly learn new products, applications, and business models.Willingness and ability to travel 50-7540-50% of the time domestically within the sales territory including occasional overnight stays.Ability to answer technical questions utilizing published information catalogs for bearings, seals and maintenance products related, but not limited to: Nomenclature and design features.Shaft and Housing Fits.Basic maintenance recommendations.Perform competitor product interchanges for catalog items.
Job Skills And Competencies

Ability to communicate effectively (verbal, written, presentation).Demonstrate self-management, time management, and process management skills.Demonstrate strong technical aptitude, problem solving and analytical skills.Ability to influence others (negotiating skills, persuasiveness, and tenacity to follow up).Demonstrate project management skills; adept to working with all levels of an organization.Ability to develop positive and lasting relationships with internal and external customers.Demonstrate understanding and ability to communicate technical information.Demonstrate sales skills (effective questioning, active listening, consultation).Ability to prioritize technical support resources based on retention and/or customer growth value.Proficient knowledge of full SKF enterprise product offering.Ability to identify opportunity; develop and execute winning strategy.Demonstrate ability to use tools/resources to improve efficiency, handle customer needs, reduce costs.

description:

title: iOS Developer Ttraining
description: We are seeking a talented iOS Developer to embark on a unique opportunity that combines a 3-month intensive training program with subsequent deployment on projects for our esteemed clients across the United States. As an iOS Developer, you will undergo comprehensive training to master the intricacies of iOS app development before applying your skills to deliver high-quality solutions for our top-tier clients.Key Responsibilities:1.Training Phase:Engage in a rigorous 3-month training program tailored to enhance your expertise in iOS development.Work closely with experienced mentors to learn advanced concepts, best practices, and cutting-edge technologies relevant to iOS app development.Develop a deep understanding of design patterns, coding standards, version, control, and industry trends.2.Development and Client Engagement Phase: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, test, and deploy iOS applications that meet the unique requirements of our prestigious clients.Leverage your training to write efficient, maintainable, and high-quality code following established coding guidelines. Participate in client meetings to gather requirements, present solutions, and receive feedback.Interface with UI/UX designers to implement visually captivating and user-centric interfaces.Integrate third-party APIs and services to enhance app functionality and user experience. Address technical challenges and debug issues to ensure optimal app performance.3.Quality Assurance and Deployment:Conduct thorough testing to identify and rectify bugs, performance bottlenecks, and usability concerns.Collaborate closely with quality assurance teams to ensure the delivery of polished and flawless applications. Manage the deployment process, adhering to Apple's App Store guidelines and ensuring a seamless release.4.Client Relationship and Communication: Foster strong relationships with clients by effectively understanding and addressing their requirements and concerns.Communicate project progress, updates, and challenges to clients in a clear and professional manner.Adapt to evolving client needs and make strategic recommendations to enhance apps features and functionalities.5.Continuous Learning and Growth:Stay updated on the latest developments in iOS app development and related technologies. Attend workshops, conferences, and online courses to continuously improve your skills and knowledge.Qualifications and Requirements:Must have Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).Understanding of principles and basics of programming languages.Hands on knowledge of solving problems via competitive programming.Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, and client-focused environment.Good to havePrevious personal or professional iOS app development projects.Proficiency in Swift and familiarity with Objective-C.Understanding of mobile app design principles, user experience, and interface design.Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and collaborative development workflows.

title: Receptionist
description:
Northern Alliance is dedicated to serving the entire state, providing our vast expertise in various industry sectors. With a team that has more than a hundred years of combined knowledge and resources, we are eager to find talented individuals who are prepared to make a meaningful contribution and thrive in our dynamic industry.
We are looking for an Administrative Assistant to join our team at our headquarters in Auburn, Maine. This vital position ensures the smooth operation of our office by managing clerical tasks, coordinating communication within the team and with advisors and clients, and supporting our marketing efforts, scheduling procedures, and client file management.
Salary range: $45,000 - $50,000
Key Responsibilities:Serve as the first point of contact for NAF, presenting a warm and professional welcome to prospects and clients.Facilitate communications among staff, advisors, and clients, providing necessary information as required.Support the management of Blue Leaf, including updating accounts, merging, sending invites, and managing mail requests.Ensure office procedures are organized and efficiently executed.Manage data entry, client appointment scheduling and confirmation, and the generation of birthday lists.Take charge of document filing and maintaining office supplies.Handle all incoming and outgoing mail and FedEx deliveries.
Preferred Qualifications:Experience in an administrative role within the financial services sector.Strong organizational, time management, and communication abilities.Proficient in multitasking, with excellent telephone handling skills.Experience with scheduling and a collaborative team spirit.Attention to detail.Competent in using computers and various technical software.Proficiency in customer service, both verbal and written.Familiarity with software applications like Microsoft Office Suite, Blue Leaf, and Redtail.
We are committed to creating a supportive and dynamic environment. We value the contributions of our employees and strive to foster growth and efficiency. If you are organized, detail-oriented, and passionate about providing exceptional administrative support, we encourage you to apply.
Northern Alliance Financial is an equal-opportunity employer. Our ethos embraces diversity and inclusion, fostering an atmosphere where every employee's unique insights are valued and respected

title: Senior Project Manager
description:
The Senior Project Manager role manages all aspects of a project, including large projects with high level of complexity. Responsible for the overall financial outcome of a project and translates project outcomes to the impact on the organization as a whole. Serves as a subject-matter expert, trainer, and mentor and is sought after for consultation and participation in project decisions. Responsibilities
Manage and handle large, complex projects competently.Assume primary leadership responsibilities for each assigned project.Manage all aspects of a project by conducting effective pre-planning meetings, maximizing resources in the buyout process, and supporting the field and/or shop to perform work efficiently.Direct a team through project execution, which includes gaining the respect of field personnel and managing the diverse expectations and opinions of all involved parties.Evaluate the contractual scope of work. Plan, organize and staff key project positions through coordination with regional department heads and general superintendents.Initiate and maintain liaison with prime client and other contacts to coordinate scheduling activities and facilitate successful construction activities.Negotiate, prepare and issue subcontracts.Monitor/control project development through administrative direction of on-site project superintendent. Prepare, issue and update master project schedule and variance reports to ensure project is built on schedule and within budget.Manage all financial aspects of contracts (costs, billings and collections) to maintain profitability goals and positive cash flow while simultaneously maintaining a positive relationship with the client.Makes well-informed, effective, and timely decisions with limited guidance.Manage risks. Investigate potentially serious situations to circumvent problems or promptly implement corrective measures as required.Actively pursue additional work through change orders.Attend job progress meetings as required. Develop and maintain viable long-term relationships with customers, consultants, prime contractors and subcontractors.Develops and maintains network of industry contacts including GC, suppliers, vendors, trade organizations, and others.Uses knowledge and experience to make suggestions for improvement and assists in developing project managers and assistant project managers.Serves as a trainer within and outside of assigned group; develops and delivers training contentPerform additional duties and assignments as requested/needed.
Qualifications
Deep knowledge of construction, preconstruction, design, finance, and project management.Trains, coaches, and mentors others effectively.Ability to focus on long-term goals, while faced with short-term goals and challenges; sees big picture.Demonstrates a solid understanding of key functional areas including: business development, preconstruction, means and methods, project planning and scheduling, cost reporting, and budgeting.Strong interpersonal communication skills, including verbal, written, listening, and presentation.Strong ability to lead, manage, and facilitate meetings.Outstanding organizational skills; handles completing priorities and deadlines effectively.Strong leadership of projects and project teams; demonstrates servant leadership mentality.Expert ability to influence others, resolve conflict, and negotiate.Consistent reputation of being approachable, respectful, personally accountable, positive, and easy to work with.Courteous, professional, diplomatic, and highly motivated.Demonstrates a value of continuous learning and growth; proactively seeks out and acts on feedback; helps others learn and grow.Takes initiative to grow professionally and develop others.Excellent MS Office and Google Suite skills and ability/desire to learn new software systems.
Requirements
2-year associate’s degree or Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent level of technical training and related construction experience).10+ years of construction/project management experience.Must obtain OSHA-30 certification within six (6) months from date of hire (if not already certified).Travel to jobsites and client sites required.

title: Plumber
description:
Posting Date

04/11/24

Application Deadline

04/25/24

Pay Range

$24.75 - $34.25 hourly

Salary offers are based on the candidate's equivalent experience and internal equity with other employees within the same job classification. The position is eligible for overtime compensation for all hours worked over 40 in the designated workweek.

Job Type

Unclassified

Department

Facilities Management

About The Position

The Operations and Maintenance division is a customer-driven team providing day-to-day maintenance and successful operation of all County facilities. We are looking for a skilled Plumber who will deliver quality work and have a strong focus on customer service to join our O&M team. The workgroup consists of numerous crafts and specialty trades, including electricians, locksmiths, trades generalists, and HVAC technicians; teamwork is a priority, working in county buildings 24 hours a day, seven days a week.

About Us

As the landlord for all facilities owned by Maricopa County, the Facilities Management Department is responsible for the planning, design, construction, maintenance, and operations of more than 200 facilities comprised of over 10 million square feet. Facilities Management is made up of a collaborative team that provides and performs various functions to meet the facility-related needs of all Maricopa County Departments. Our broad range of services includes various aspects of the ongoing operations and maintenance of all County-owned facilities, management of all facility projects, and in-house design services. 

Proud to Offer

Work with a greater purposeTuition reimbursementExceptional work-life balanceOpportunities for growth and development within Maricopa CountyLow-cost, high-value healthcare for you and your qualifying dependentsPaid vacation, sick time, and parental leaveExtensive wellness program, including healthcare premium discountsEmployee discounts for goods and servicesMaricopa County participates in the Arizona State Retirement System. This defined retirement benefit requires a 12.29% monthly contribution rate and includes a 100% employer match on Day 1Learn more at Work With Us | Maricopa County, AZ

We Require

Three years of journey-level commercial plumbing experienceHigh School Diploma or GEDCompletion of an apprenticeship program or vocational education in the plumbing field may substitute for two years of the experience requirementMust Complete a Prison Rape Elimination Act (PREA) background investigation to access County detention facilities

We Also Value

Five years of experience within a large commercial, industrial, or institutional environment. Proficient in Microsoft Office products and selected software programs, including Maximo.

Job Contributions

Remove, replace, and repair toilets, porcelain and stainless steel, faucets, valves, and meters, tempering valves, vent lines, pumps, water softeners, water heaters, showers, urinals, flush valves, flow meters, boilers, steam traps, drinking fountains, and ice machinesRepair sewer lines, grease traps, and lead cast iron jointsSafely operate sewer machines 1065, 300, 100, 80 jetters, cameras, and locatorsPerform preventive maintenance on plumbing fixtures and systemsOperate PC and Handheld devices for time management, work order assignments, status, inventory, and other functions as required Respond to emergency situations during and after hours.Other job duties as assigned

Working Conditions

Must possess or have the ability to obtain a valid Arizona driver’s license and have an acceptable driving record by the time of hireDuties require lifting/deadlifting (floor to waist) of up to 50 pounds, bending, twisting, squatting, pushing, or pulling is required of up to 100 pounds, up to 100 feet while navigating through equipment rooms, on building rooftops, and in restrictive areas. Must be able to safely climb ladders, scaffolding, and step stools in the execution of duties. Requires bending, climbing; stooping, kneeling, and crawling in all indoor and outdoor environmentsSome temperature extremes, confined areas, high noise levels, dim lighting, dust or smoke, potential contagious diseases, and traumatic subject matter. Jail environments and in hot/humid conditions on a regular basis. Exposure to various forms of hazardous energy sources relating but not limited to mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems

Selection Procedure

Only the most qualified candidates will be consideredConsideration will only be given to candidates who submit online applicationsCandidates will be contacted primarily through email and their Workday online application profileMust pass a pre-employment background and/or fingerprint investigation as required by statute or policy, including drug and alcohol testing requirements for positions designated as safety-sensitive

Maricopa County is an equal opportunity employer.

Apply Now!

title: Revenue Operations Manager
description:
Job Summary: As the Revenue Operations Manager, you will be responsible for optimizing and aligning the processes, systems, and teams involved in revenue generation, including sales, marketing, and customer success. Your role is critical in driving efficiency and effectiveness across these functions to maximize revenue growth for Metadata and our customers. In this hybrid role you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to streamline operations and implement data-driven strategies to achieve revenue goals across a wide variety of tech stacks, and business models. The ideal candidate is someone who thrives on solving new and complex problems every day, and also understands that the most elegant solutions are typically the most simple.
Key Responsibilities:Establish and maintain scalable processes that ensure best practices in campaigns, lead management, forecasting and revenue recognitionWork with the internal Metadata team as well as Metadata’s customers to scope, design, align, and execute work class marketing ops and sales ops systems and processesAnalyze go-to-market data across disparate systems to Identify strategic areas of opportunity. Translate those insights into a plan with actionable recommendations, present it to C-level executives and secure their approval to execute your vision.Manage and be accountable for the end-to-end campaign lifecycle, including:Own the Marketing tech stack (Hubspot, Salesforce, ZoomInfo, Outreach)Manage lead scoring, lead routing, attribution, and funnel conversion reportingBuild and support automation for nurture campaignsCreate and maintain metrics reports on marketing and sales activities, effectiveness, and business impact.Build strong relationships with stakeholders and manage expectationsAssist customers with technical integration into the Metadata Platform
Qualifications:2+ years of experience in Marketing OperationsStrong experience (certifications preferred but not required) with or willingness to become an expert in:CRMs: Salesforce and HubSpotMarketing Automation: Marketo, Pardot, Hubspot, and Eloqua Attribution Toolssuch as GA4, Google Data Studio, Bizible, HockeyStack, Tableau, Domo, etc.Digital Advertising Channels: Linkedin, Facebook, Instagram, X, Google Ads (Search), BingExpertise in building lead-scoring models, attribution, and campaign managementExperience with Google Analytics and Google Data Studio (nice to have)Strong understanding of the customer lifecycle and lead-to-revenue conversion funnelEnjoys interacting with internal and external stakeholders Familiarity with basic pricinples of website development (Landing Page and thank you page set up, pixels, forms, cookies, personalization)
Training Requirements:Training on the company's sales, marketing, and customer success processes and systems.Ongoing training to stay updated on revenue operations best practices and technologies.
Working Conditions:Effective communication and collaboration with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, finance, and customer success, are essential for successful revenue operations management.Travel requiredNorth American working hoursEnglish as a first language

title: Construction Manager
description:
OverviewThe Senior MEP Construction Manager is responsible for assisting in the planning, development, and construction of buildings, the redevelopment of buildings and major construction projects and tenant improvement projects within the managed portfolio. His/her primary focus is on the design, installation, testing, commissioning and initial operation of the mechanical, electrical and plumbing (MEP) systems associated with new and assigned projects, and the numerous systems that support the MEP within these projects. He/she is responsible for the review of preliminary and construction drawings and specifications, and making reports to the assigned construction manager, project manager, and Director of Building Services. In addition to the aforementioned duties, he/she serves as the primary in house consultant for MEP systems and provides guidance and assistance to the Director of Building Services, property managers, and building engineers as needed in the management and operation of the management portfolio. In this capacity he/she serves as a trouble-shooter for problems with MEP systems, provides training and skills development for all assigned engineering staff and periodic inspections of building systems to ensure that the buildings are operating as designed.
The Senior MEP Construction Manager reports to SVP Development and works in support of the SVP of Technology and Engineering. 
ResponsibilitiesDevelopment and Construction Project Support § Partner with the development and construction teams to identify and select appropriate building systems for new projects§ Review the Standards with design engineers, specifically related to MEP items§ Review preliminary construction drawings, bid sets, and construction drawings for new projects, advising responsible parties of anticipated problems and recommendations particularly with regard to MEP systems.§ Provide other support in the pre-construction phase of development as requested.§ Review specifications for new projects and make recommendations for changes.§ Review submittals and provide recommendations to accept or reject specific MEP systems. § Review submittals for acceptability and make appropriate recommendations to the project team.§ Review RFI’s for acceptability and make appropriate recommendations to the project team.§ Review other construction documents, drawings and specifications for construction projects as requested by Property Management, other engineers, project and construction managers, etc.§ Review tenant improvement project drawings and specifications to confirm appropriate tie-ins to building systems.§ Regularly walk the project site to ensure installation meets design specifications and develop an issues list for items needing correction by the project team.§ Review and approve commissioning procedures as prepared by the Project Commissioning Agent.§ Participate in the commissioning of all building systems in partnership with the project Commissioning Agent.§ Commission and review all MEP equipment on the project.§ Review change orders and recommendations for change that affect MEP systems.§ Ensure the receipt of final permits, manuals, as built drawings, etc. at the completion of the construction project.§ Transition project from construction to operations with appropriate overlap to ensure operating engineer and building staff are fully knowledgeable of system operations.

Development and Construction Project Support § Partner with the development and construction teams to identify and select appropriate building systems for new projects§ Review the Standards with design engineers, specifically related to MEP items§ Review preliminary construction drawings, bid sets, and construction drawings for new projects, advising responsible parties of anticipated problems and recommendations particularly with regard to MEP systems.§ Provide other support in the pre-construction phase of development as requested.§ Review specifications for new projects and make recommendations for changes.§ Review submittals and provide recommendations to accept or reject specific MEP systems. § Review submittals for acceptability and make appropriate recommendations to the project team.§ Review RFI’s for acceptability and make appropriate recommendations to the project team.§ Review other construction documents, drawings and specifications for construction projects as requested by Property Management, other engineers, project and construction managers, etc.§ Review tenant improvement project drawings and specifications to confirm appropriate tie-ins to building systems.§ Regularly walk the project site to ensure installation meets design specifications and develop an issues list for items needing correction by the project team.§ Review and approve commissioning procedures as prepared by the Project Commissioning Agent.§ Participate in the commissioning of all building systems in partnership with the project Commissioning Agent.§ Commission and review all MEP equipment on the project.§ Review change orders and recommendations for change that affect MEP systems.§ Ensure the receipt of final permits, manuals, as built drawings, etc. at the completion of the construction project.§ Transition project from construction to operations with appropriate overlap to ensure operating engineer and building staff are fully knowledgeable of system operations.
QualificationsThe Senior MEP Construction Manager must be a leader with the integrity to set a superior example of both technical skills and interpersonal relationships. He/she is expected to be technically competent and the most knowledgeable company resource in their field and is expected to routinely keep abreast of new developments, equipment and procedures in building operations. Communication skills, the ability to organize and a willingness to follow through are essential qualifications for this position. It is preferred for one to possess a high school diploma and at least five years of construction experience in order to fill this position. It is also desired that one be a certified commissioning agent.

title: Dealer Sales Manager
description:
At Generac, our people help make the world safer, brighter, and more productive. We are united by our efforts to inspire change for a better world; impact our people and community; influence and achieve positive results; and innovate the industry. Our shared goals allow people with diverse backgrounds and points of view to work together, bringing our global customers peace of mind through reliable products and exceptional support.
Job Summary: As a Dealer Sales Manager you will be responsible for driving sales growth and managing relationships within our dealer network. Your primary focus will be on fostering partnerships, implementing sales strategies, and ensuring the achievement of sales targets. This role requires a proactive and strategic approach to dealer engagement and an ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams. 
 Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Develop and execute comprehensive sales strategies to achieve revenue and growth targets within the dealer networkIdentify and onboard new dealers, ensuring alignment with our brand values and sales objectivesBuild and maintain strong relationships with existing dealers, acting as their primary point of contact for all sales-related mattersProvide training, support, and resources to dealers to enhance their product knowledge and selling skillsAnalyze market trends, competitive landscape, and customer preferences to identify opportunities for growthPrepare accurate sales forecast, performance reports, and market analysis for management review.Coordinate with internal teams, such as product development and customer support, to ensure seamless dealer interactions and efficient issue resolutionCollaborate with the marketing team to develop and deliver effective promotional campaigns to drive dealer sales

Physical demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear; and use hands to manipulate objects or controls. The employee is regularly required to stand and walk. On occasion the incumbent may be required to stoop, bend or reach above the shoulders. The employee must occasionally lift up to 25 pounds. Specific conditions of this job include are typical of frequent and continuous computer-based work requiring periods of sitting, close vision and ability to adjust focus. Travel by car and plane required.

title: Proposal Specialist
description:
Brewer-Garrett (BG), a trusted leader in the facility solutions industry, has been providing engineering, design, installation, and operations and maintenance services for over six decades. BG’s purpose is to offer superior excellence, reliability, and innovation that meets the needs of our clients across various industries, including educational institutions, commercial buildings, government, and healthcare facilities. BG’s commitment to offering comprehensive facility solutions has led us to be recognized by the National Association of Energy Service Companies (NAESCO) as an Accredited Energy Service Company, and also by the Federal government as one of 20 energy service companies, world-wide, to be awarded the DoE ESPC Generation 4 IDIQ contract. Our mission is to raise the benchmark in customer service for the building services and energy industry by making a substantial investment in people, programs, and technology.
JOB SUMMARY: This person will coordinate the development, assembly, packaging, and submission of RFPs and RFQs for potential clients in order to generate new business. They will be part of a team that welcomes and encourages new ideas and innovations; working closely with both executives and associates. The proposal specialist will designate assignments and will craft persuasive and accurate descriptions on how Brewer-Garrett best fits the expectations and outcomes of a potential client. This role is specialized for individuals with a keen sense of detail; excellent writing, editing, and time management skills; the ability to meet deadlines; and a willingness to learn.
DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:Collaborates throughout the proposal process including the coordination of project-specific information, development of content, and meeting all essential guidelines and target datesPrepares and manages the development and execution of responses to Sources Sought, Statement of Qualifications (SOQ), Request for Qualifications (RFQ), Request for Proposals (RFP), and presentations Reviews and interprets solicitation documentsConducts kick-off meetings with bid team membersAssembles and populates proposals (based on solicitation requirements and answers from Q&A meetings)Utilizes templates to ensure consistency and best practiceCreates precise, well-written narratives for non-technical proposal inquiriesEnlists subject matter experts for project specific technical narrativesCreates/assists in the development of graphic/visualsProofreads, edits, and formats proposalsEnsures proposals are compliantPrints, assembles, and readies proposals for overnight delivery, hand delivery, and/or electronic submissionDevelops presentations and supporting materials for proposal interviews, to include interview prep, Q&A with bid team, situation practices, and providing feedbackContributes to the upkeep of the proposal databaseMaintains excellent communication skills throughout the entire proposal processDevelops and maintains written and graphic promotional materialExhibits outstanding organizational skills and accurately populates all project-specific information in the databaseWorks exceptionally well in a team and promotes a professional environmentPerforms other duties as assigned
QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, writing, English, and/or editingProficient in Microsoft Office Suite, SharePoint, Teams, Word, Excel, and SalesforceExcellent verbal and written communication skillsExcellent organization skillsAbility to balance workload, prioritize, and work under tight deadlines with a positive attitudeAbility to work independently without supervisionAbility to function effectively as part of a teamSelf-motivated, goal-oriented, and quality-drivenFlexible to work outside of normal business hours, as required
WHAT WILL SET YOU APART: Previous experience with managing social media Excellent organizational/project management skillsExperience in the proposal processKnowledge in Adobe Creative Suite(In-Design, Illustrator)Strong communication skills (oral and written); must be able to effectively relay information to various audience groups.Strong interpersonal skills; ability to foster and maintain positive working relationships with individuals internal and external to the company and from various backgroundsStrong organization skills with the ability to self-motivate and prioritize tasks; must be able to effectively manage own schedule with limited oversightMust be able to prepare professional written communications (emails, documents, etc.) Must demonstrate professionalism and tact in all interactionsDemonstration of time-management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlinesGood analytical skills; ability to analyze data and relay trends and potential outcomes; ability to evaluate problems and identify resolutions; good negotiation skillsAbility to maintain satisfactory attendance
WORKING CONDITIONS & PHYSICAL DEMANDS: 
Physical Demands:The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; talk or hear. The employee must occasionally lift or move products and supplies, up to 50 pounds.
BG offers competitive pay and an outstanding benefits package that includes a 401(k) with company match, health/dental/vision, life insurance, disability insurance, flexible spending, paid time off, yearly performance bonus, on-site gym, and a great work environment! 
BG is proud to be an EOE and Drug-Free Workplace.

title: Prevention Specialist
description:
Come be a part of something big! Smart Minds, Cool Jobs and Awesome Rewards! Fueled by innovation, talent and ambition, the Air Force Civilian Service (AFCS) is seeking civilian professionals prepared to deploy war-winning capabilities for the United States Air Force and Space Force.
The Air Force Civilian Service (AFCS) is looking for a Full-Time Prevention Specialist, (GS-0101-11) to serve in the 377 Air Base Wing (ABW), Office of the Wing Commander, Installation Integrated Resilience Office (IRO), Kirtland Air Force Base (AFB), Albuquerque, New Mexico. 
Salary: $73,317 – 83,092 based on experience
Relocation and Recruitment incentive are available for those who qualify
This position can close at any time. Apply Now!
Qualifications/Requirements:In this position, your major responsibilities include completion of administrative functions, budget execution, and implementation of primary prevention education and training for the total base population. Also works collaboratively with installation Integrated Resilience Office (IRO) partners to coordinate and integrate prevention activities to effectively prevent negative outcomes associated with sexual assault and harassment, family violence (incl. intimate partner violence and child abuse and neglect), workplace violence (incl. harassment, bullying and hazing), suicide, and alcohol abuse/misuse prevention, hereafter referred to as self-directed harm and prohibited abusive or harmful acts.
Must be a U.S. Citizen
Must be able to obtain & maintain a “Secret” Security clearance
Must be able to obtain and maintain the required credentials for the position
Incumbent must meet screening/suitability criteria
Given the sensitivity of the position, a criminal background check must be completed
This is a Mission-Essential position performing a Mission-Critical-Function which must continue uninterrupted
Degree: At least a bachelor’s degree in a behavioral or social science; or related disciplines appropriate to the position.ORCombination of education and experience that provided the applicant with knowledge of one or more of the behavioral or social sciences equivalent to a major in the field.ORFour years of appropriate experience that demonstrated that the applicant has acquired knowledge of one or more of the behavioral or social sciences equivalent to a major in the field.
Comprehensive and professional knowledge of laws, regulations, and policies as well as behavioral, social science and/or public health practices principles and theories relating to the prevention of violence.
Thorough knowledge of a wide range of delivery systems relating to violence prevention and the multiple uses of such systems.
Knowledge of principles and methods for curriculum and training design, teaching and instruction for individuals and groups, and the measurement of training effects.
Knowledge of various office automation software programs, tools, and techniques to support office operations and produce a variety of documents, such as letters, reports, spreadsheets, databases, and graphs.
HIGHLY DESIRED:Knowledge and experience within primary prevention
You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.

title: Actuarial Director
description:
Actuarial Director Location: This position will work a hybrid model (remote and office). The Ideal candidate will live within 50 miles of one of our Elevance Health PulsePoint locations.  The Actuarial Director will be responsible for identifying, evaluating and responding to financial risks inherent in the pricing and development of health insurance products.  How you will make an impact:Prepares and interprets data and related formulae.Monitors trend of profit and profitability by line of business and/or productServes on major, multi-function projects as Actuarial representative.Organizes and directs the staffing and workflow of the section.  Minimum Requirements:Requires a BA/BS degree and minimum of 6 years related experience; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.  Preferred Skills, Capabilities, and Experiences:FSA required from the Society of Actuaries (SOA).Advance degree preferred.Self-starter with proficient programming and communication skills for a director level opportunity.Advance data analytics experience with Sequel/VBA/Excel strongly preferred.Prior experience in underwriting and risk management strongly preferred.
 
Please be advised that Elevance Health only accepts resumes for compensation from agencies that have a signed agreement with Elevance Health. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Elevance Health.
Who We Are
Elevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities - and making healthcare simpler. We are a Fortune 25 company with a longstanding history in the healthcare industry, looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve.
How We Work
At Elevance Health, we are creating a culture that is designed to advance our strategy but will also lead to personal and professional growth for our associates. Our values and behaviors are the root of our culture. They are how we achieve our strategy, power our business outcomes and drive our shared success - for our consumers, our associates, our communities and our business.
We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.
Elevance Health operates in a Hybrid Workforce Strategy. Unless specified as primarily virtual by the hiring manager, associates are required to work at an Elevance Health location at least once per week, and potentially several times per week. Specific requirements and expectations for time onsite will be discussed as part of the hiring process. Candidates must reside within 50 miles or 1-hour commute each way of a relevant Elevance Health location.
The health of our associates and communities is a top priority for Elevance Health. We require all new candidates in certain patient/member-facing roles to become vaccinated against COVID-19. If you are not vaccinated, your offer will be rescinded unless you provide an acceptable explanation. Elevance Health will also follow all relevant federal, state and local laws.
Elevance Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, citizenship status, color, creed, disability, ethnicity, genetic information, gender (including gender identity and gender expression), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status or condition protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. title: Lead Project Accountant/Client Billing Professional
description: Lead Project Accountant/Client Billing Professional, Laramie, WY  Trihydro, one of the top environmental and engineering consulting firms in the country, has an opening for a Lead Project Accountant Professional. The Lead Project Accountant will join our Accounting and Finance Team and lead a team of accountants in providing outstanding accounting support for a wide variety of clients. If you have prior management experience, are detail oriented and self-motivated and have strong critical thinking skills we encourage you to apply!  Now more than ever, the world needs smart, innovative solutions to address the engineering and environmental challenges of tomorrow. That’s where we come in. As a member of our team, you will support the accounting functions of our diverse range of clients, from Fortune 100 companies to the federal government, to local communities nationwide to continuously improve human health and the environment.  In your role as Lead Project Accountant, you will supervise and support project accounting staff in providing solution driven approaches to resolve client/project accounting processes. This position will understand and manage the entire accounting lifecycle of a project from proposal stage to new project setup, client billing/collections and project close out. Other duties will include leading client billing system transition efforts, training and communicating standard and consistent billing practices. As a Lead Project Accountant, you will work with your team and Group Manager to continuously improve accounting processes to maximize efficiency and ensure a quality work product for our clients.  The preferred location for this position is Laramie, WY, which is home to Trihydro’s Corporate Headquarters. Laramie is a great community that provides ready access to multiple recreational opportunities, opportunities associated with state colleges, and mountain west living.  Our team is looking for someone who: Is self-motivated and driven to help create efficient accounting solutions for our unique clients Has acceptable written and oral communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively with accounting staff, clients and project team members Is dependable, has a strong attention to detail and a strong desire to provide a quality and accurate work product to our clients Has a prior experience leading team members through new processes and systems Is a team player who can foster a cooperative work environment with project teams, clients and accounting staff  This position requires the following: Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or Business-related field or equivalent of 5 years prior job experience in accounting Strong attention to detail Strong sense of self-motivation Delegate and manage staff priorities to meet client needs Ability and experience navigating an accounting or ERP systems Proficient experience with Microsoft Excel  This job may be for you if: You want to be part of a dynamic company that treats its team members like family Are interested in being a key part of the company’s continued expansion and growth  At Trihydro, our approach to work is honest and hard-working. You’ll find a company culture that is dedicated to excellence, nurtures collaboration and growth, and still finds plenty of time for fun – often outdoors! Some of the benefits of joining our team include: Robust health insurance (medical, dental, vision, and prescription) Industry-leading 401(k) retirement plan, including a discretionary 6% match by Trihydro Comprehensive paid time off including vacation, flex, sick, paid family leave and holiday pay Wellness program, including reimbursement for gym membership or related expenses Staff mentoring and opportunities for professional/career advancement This office-based position is ideal for individuals who thrive in collaborative settings and are eager to learn and grow within their field Best-in-class safety culture built to protect our employees – the mothers, fathers, sons, and daughters who deserve to go home safely each night  Trihydro is humbled to have received an honorable mention in Outside Magazine’s “Best Places to Work” list. Our 500+ professionals work on meaningful environmental and engineering projects that make a difference for clients and communities. Trihydro’s offices extend from Alaska to Florida, and our team members live and work within minutes of outdoor recreation. As a team of geologists, engineers, ecologists, and scientists, our culture is rooted in a love for the outdoors.  This position will remain open until a qualified candidate has been selected.  This is a full-time position averaging 40 hours per week. Interested candidates should apply at https://www.trihydro.com/about-us/careers with their application, resume, and cover letter addressed to Trihydro’s Recruiting Department.  Trihydro is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability or because of a protected Veteran status.

title: USL Automation Engineer
description:
Job Summary

The Control and Automation Engineer is responsible for designing, developing, documenting, testing and commissioning industrial automation and control systems within constraints such as development cost, product quality, product safety and time.

Additional Responsibilities

 Work with other engineering domains, such as mechanical, electrical and Information Technology (IT), to solve cross-domain problems related to automation equipment and processes involving the use of sensors, actuators and IT infrastructure.  Analyze domain problems and identify, adapt and develop technologies from the fields of automated and autonomous systems and industrial automation to address them.  Document and validate automated processes with domain experts.  Evaluate and develop probabilistic state estimation techniques that are relevant and applicable to decision-making automated systems.  Integrate systems and software, considering qualities such as security, safety, performance and reliability.  Support the senior technical team in the creation of a technical roadmap for advanced technologies stack.  Support the engineering team in understanding and implementing technologies.  Support and perform technology transfers from technical collaboration projects in areas of planning under uncertainty, machine learning, probabilistic reasoning and cognitive systems.  Liaise between Research and Operations organizations to promote appropriate decision-making technologies and solutions.

Bachelor's degree with minimum 5 years of experience.Bachelor’s degree in Electronic, electrical, IT engineering.Knowledge of SAP.Knowledge of Helpdesk 365 or similar application.

title: Chemical Engineer
description:
MAIN TASKS

The main tasks of this position are to develop new technologies and support laboratory requests from the operations, sales, and supply chain organizations.

RESPONSIBILITY

The Chemical Engineer is responsible for activities within the scope of work and applicable procedures, and to fulfil these tasks in an efficient and cost-effective manner. In addition to the tasks listed in the scope of work this function may also be assigned specialized tasks.

SCOPE OF WORK

Contribute to the design and the development of new products and technologies and assist in their commercialization. Apply relevant usability procedures and principles. Perform product evaluation testing. Experiments may include, but are not limited to, high pressure / high temperature (HPHT) core flow experiments, HPHT rheology, HPHT batch reactor experiments, rotating disk experiments, permeability measurements, HPHT fluid loss experiments, ambient and/or elevated temperature proppant settling, sand conglomeration/consolidation, friction pressure measurements, proppant conductivity, and slot flow experiments. Support third-party testing and yard tests for the technologies being developed. Communication: prepare technical reports and presentations for new product development team in addition to other internal stakeholders. Responsible for maintenance, calibration, and training of common and special laboratory equipment. Coordinate, actively participate and work independently in short- and long-term projects with technical & operation groups within the Reservoir Performance – Stimulation (RPS) organization. Recommend and write procedures or other changes to improve operation of the laboratory. Recommend purchasing of laboratory testing equipment. Be familiar with RPS chemical products and services. Conduct laboratory tours and demonstrations. Prepare chemical samples for shipment to other laboratories (domestic and international) and coordinate the transportation processes. 


QUALITY, HEALTH, SAFETY, AND ENVIRONMENT (QHSE)

Ensure that company QHSE policies, procedures and safety standards are always understood and complied with. Make sure that chemicals and waste are handled according to regulations, chemical hygiene plan, and SDS. Carry out necessary risk assessments prior to laboratory operations. Report, investigate and follow up all relevant QHSE matters in accordance with internal nonconformance and hazard observation reporting procedures. Maintain an active role in the identification of opportunities for improvement in the company’s QHSE management systems and where relevant, assist in the implementation of the improvements. University degree (PhD, or equivalent) in chemistry, chemical engineering, petroleum engineering, biology, biological engineering, materials science, or related fields Experience: 0 to 5 years in chemical or upstream energy research and development

title: Sales Representative
description:
Our client, an after market manufacturer and installer of walk-in tubs, with office thorughout the United States, is seeking a Sales Representative to join their team.

As an In-Home Sales Representative, you have the exciting opportunity to be part of a dynamic team that provides life-changing products to our customers. With a steady flow of pre-set, confirmed sales appointments, you'll have the tools you need to excel in this role and earn a substantial income.

Customized Solutions: Assess customers' bathrooms and living spaces to recommend the most suitable walk-in tub solutions, taking into account their unique physical requirements and lifestyle.

Run Confirmed Leads: Travel within your local market area and attend an average of two leads per day, meeting with potential customers at their homes.

title: Director of Public Affairs and Communications
description: Job description    Clear Strategy is seeking a U.S. Director of Public Affairs and Communications, with experience in environmental and sustainability issues, to join our team. Reporting to the U.S. Vice President of Policy & Public Affairs, this individual will serve as a core member of the Clear Strategy team in support of our client’s communication, policy, stakeholder engagement, and public affairs efforts.   This role is a perfect fit for someone who is passionate and knowledgeable about sustainability and has experience working as a consultant or in-house supporting organizations in defining, articulating, and building external support for sustainability and policy positions. The ideal candidate will have a blend of experience in public affairs and communications, will excel in project management and client service, and bring creativity to help Clear’s clients achieve ambitious policy goals, communicate with a range of internal and external stakeholders, and demonstrate leadership on environmental and sustainability initiatives. Experience or familiarity with circular economy issues and initiatives is a plus.  This role offers high visibility to clients, allowing you to have impact through day-to-day account management and lead both strategy and execution for client engagements. This is also an exciting opportunity to work with and learn from our team of experienced public affairs, policy and communications professionals.     Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to    Lead and manage client engagements from conception to execution.  Initiate, create and develop work plans and key deliverables for our clients.   Establish and grow trust with our clients by demonstrating strategic thinking, subject matter and sector expertise, and an ability to identify and act on emerging opportunities and challenges. Develop high-quality written materials for use with a variety of audiences including stakeholders, media, policymakers, and internal decision-makers. Demonstrate strong understanding of how policy is made and influenced in the U.S. and bring forward recommendations to support clients’ policy goals and business objectives through thought leadership, coalition-building and the execution of communications and advocacy campaigns. Support Clear Strategy leadership in managing the business with effective oversight and execution of client engagement activities.  Contribute to ongoing company success by proactively identifying client expansion opportunities, and operational improvements and efficiencies.    Preferred skills & qualifications    At least 7-10 years of relevant professional experience in communications, public affairs, U.S. sustainability and environmental policy, or some combination. Strong preference for candidates with experience in circular economy policy. Experience working within a public affairs agency or managing agencies in house. Strategic thinker with an excellent grasp of sustainability issues and policies, factors that influence policy making, and communications, and stakeholder engagement and communications strategies to advance policy and business objectives. Experience researching and summarizing sustainability trends and complex policies for a range of internal and external audiences, with specific ability to communicate and engage confidently with executive leaders.  Ability to synthesize information and take the initiative to quickly produce relevant content (e.g. briefing and strategy documents, presentations and external communications) to advance client success.  Ability to apply critical thinking, creativity, and industry knowledge to address client needs effectively. Outstanding oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills. Experienced project manager, with exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills. Strong people leader, able to motivate and support team success. Curiosity and a desire to learn, develop new expertise, and problem solve. Eligible to work in the US.  Bachelor's degree; advanced degree in a relevant field is a plus.     What we offer     We are a boutique agency and our team is entrepreneurial with a growth mindset. We are building a culture that’s perfect for passionate, lifelong learners and doers.  We have a supportive and collaborative team culture that values professional development and empowers people to pursue their interests and new challenges. We will facilitate your ongoing growth and development by supporting your attendance at relevant conferences, events and networking opportunities.  We are a rapidly growing team, and there is significant opportunity for career growth and advancement.  A full-time position with competitive salary, performance-based bonuses and other incentives.  Comprehensive benefits inclusive of health (medical/dental/vision) insurance, retirement savings options, four weeks paid vacation, and more. Remote working environment including monthly co-working space subscription. About us       Clear Strategy is a boutique policy and public affairs agency that helps clients shape their external operating environment. title: Senior Accountant
description:
Hi, we’re HUB. We are proud to be ranked 5th among the world’s largest insurance brokerages, advising businesses and individuals on how to prepare for the unexpected. At HUB we believe in investing in the future of our employees. Our entrepreneurial culture fosters an environment of open feedback and improvement that empowers our people to make the best decisions for our clients and organization. 
We are currently hiring a Senior Accountant in the Hub Financial Center (HFC), the centralized accounting team for HUB International. The Senior Accountant reports to the Accounting & Compliance Supervisor and is responsible for overseeing the work of junior and staff accountants, monthly closing processes, and preparing and approving journal entries, bank reconciliations, and balance sheet reconciliations.
