title: Business Analyst (onsite)
description:
Job Description

Business Analyst

Columbia SC  (Work is 100% onsite)

NO C2C, NO H1B

The Business Analyst will assist with the implementation of small to large projects. Projects will include integration of other systems with the eligibility systems, such as Salesforce.

The principal duties of this position are to evaluate agency needs, as-is and to-be business processes, technical designs, to provide analysis, and provide advice on strategies for information technology solutions and non-technical solutions. The BA will provide detailed analysis, document business processes, and document requirements.

Specific Duties Include But Are Not Limited To

 Serves as a liaison between the business programs and the IT organization to provide technical solutions to meet user needs.

 Possesses expertise in the business unit(s) they support, as well as an understanding of the IT organization's systems and capabilities.

 Analyzes business partner's operations to understand their strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to automate processes and functions.

 Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology and/or enhancements to existing technology.

 Translates high level business requirements into functional specifications for the IT organization and manages changes to such specifications. Educates the IT organization on the direction of the business.

 Possesses an understanding of technological trends and uses this knowledge to bring solutions to business units supported to enhance the enterprise's competitive edge.

 Requirements development execution, including the elicitation, analysis, specification and validation.

 Documenting and analyzing agency business processes and recommending improvements.

 Documenting and analyzing data requirements and relationships in requirement documents; including process models.

 Participating in the requirements management processes, including change control, version control, tracking and status reporting, review/approval, and traceability.

 Providing requirements interpretation and guidance to technical and testing teams.

 Proactively identifying risks, issues, and action items leading to possible solutions.

 Interacting with internal and external organizations (i.e. vendors, State and Federal government agencies, State providers and beneficiaries, and other stakeholders).

 Research business rules, requirements, and models.

 Maintain business rules, requirements, and models in a repository per the agencys operating procedures.

Required -

 5 years experience in government IT projects as a business analyst or related duties

 5 years experience eliciting, mining, and documenting business rules, processes

 3 years Medicaid or healthcare experience

 Superb written and oral communications skills, including the ability to write requirements and Use Cases.

 Experience and ability to obtain business processes and requirements information by interviewing business personnel and by mining laws, regulations, and policy documents.

 Knowledge of formal business process documentation.

 Understanding of business modeling techniques, including the use of graphical process flow software

Preferred -

General Subject Matter Expertise as it relates to Medicaid or other healthcare insurance experience (project or operations)

 Salesforce and/or Salesforce Marketing Cloud

 Microsoft Office Project/Project Server

REQUIRED EDUCATION: Bachelors degree in a technical, business, or healthcare field. Equivalent experience in business/systems analysis and/or computer systems development/modification may be substituted.

description:
Create a healthier, brighter future for pets, pet parents and people!

If you want to make a real difference, create an exciting career path, feel welcome to be your whole self and nurture your wellbeing, Petco is the place for you.

Our core values capture that spirit as we work to improve lives by doing what’s right for pets, people and our planet.

We love all pets like our ownWe’re the future of the pet industryWe’re here to improve livesWe drive outstanding results togetherWe’re welcome as we are

Petco is a category-defining health and wellness company focused on improving the lives of pets, pet parents and Petco partners. We are 29,000 strong, working together across 1,500+ pet care centers, 250+ Vetco Total Care hospitals, hundreds of preventive care clinics, eight distribution centers and two support centers.

Schedule: 3:00 pm - 1:30 am, Monday-Friday with OT as needed

Pay: $22.25/hour

Why work at “just another job” when you can join Petco where we “work for you”! We raise the bar, we build communities.

We offer a Safe, Diverse, and Inclusive work environment, flexible schedules, competitive starting rates and career growth opportunities.We have amazing benefits and discounts worth barking about.We deliver healthy and happy experiences for pets and the people who love them by providing products, services, advice and experiences that keep pets physically fit, mentally alert, socially engaged and emotionally happy!

To facilitate the timely and accurate preparation of pet supplies to be shipped to the Petco stores and to receive warehouse stock goods. This job is composed of several tasks which are generally routine in nature and are repeated several times during the course of the day and are part of the Petco Labor Management System in which productivity standards must be met. This is a safety sensitive position that requires drug testing.

Essential Job Functions: Through previous background and experience, the candidate must demonstrate, with or without an accommodation, the ability to:

 Operate Material Handling equipment including but not limited to: pallet jacks and standup lifts. Maintain established productivity standards. Continuously lift merchandise up to 50 pounds daily for entire shift duration. Use voice activated computer headset to select merchandise. Use hand-held RF devices as needed to scan merchandise bar codes Conduct basic math computations, with or without a calculator.

Supervisory Responsibility

Although this position generally does not entail supervising other employees, management may on occasion delegate additional responsibility to include providing functional guidance and training to others.

Work Environment

In addition to extensive bending, carrying, lifting (in excess of 50 pounds routinely), and climbing, the nature of this position entails constant exposure to heat, cold, dirt, dust, fumes, and noise within the warehouse. While some job duties may occasionally be conducted outdoors, the majority of work is performed indoors at one location. Risk of injury in this type of work should not be overlooked.

title: USSTRATCOM Project Leader
description:
Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us.

USSTRATCOM and NC3 (Nuclear Command, Control, and Communications) Operations Department (N257) provides a whole range of systems engineering, data analytics, architecture design expertise in supporting development of our nation’s nuclear and electromagnetic spectrum capabilities. N257 is located at Omaha, NE and directly supports USSTRATCOM and NC3 Enterprise Center (NEC) sponsors execute their respective missions. USSTRATCOM’s mission is to deter strategic attack and employ forces, as directed, to guarantee the security of the U.S. and its allies. The NEC’s mission is to ensure NC3 operations are “ready to fight tonight,” while defining requirement, engineering, and developing the future NC3 concepts and capabilities to deter future threats.

Job Description:

This is a 12 STE project that develops future capabilities to support the National Defense Strategy’s mandate of instituting Integrated Deterrence measures across the DoD, the Nation, and our allies. The work supports an exciting variety of challenges across our sponsor base such as: electromagnetic spectrum operations, cybersecurity analytics, network resiliency analysis, and operational and military utility analysis. MITRE is directly supporting systems engineering, model-based analysis, agile acquisition approaches and a variety of analytics to evolve the nation’s nuclear planning capability to outpace the threats. We have been at the start of the standup of a new Joint Electromagnetic Spectrum Operations (JEMSO) Center (JEC) organization and have been applying a variety of systems engineering and analytics to progress that mission across the DoD in support of MITRE’s cross cutting priority (CCP) and seedling focus. We continue to explore data strategies, applications of unique analysis and technologies across USSTRATCOM’s science and technology priorities, to include progressing the DoD’s Chief Data Officer’s vision and robusting cyber security and zero-trust mandates. And we are exploring further opportunities to expand the impact of other MITRE CCPs across STRATCOM’s UCP missions.

Roles and Responsibilities:

Provide project leadership, technical contributions, and systems engineering knowledge, nuclear force planning/operations expertise, USSTRATCOM operational/systems architecture development expertise, prototyping leadership, to shape future operating/system paradigms to foster integration of USSTRATCOM’s role in a globally integrated Joint enterprise. Familiarity with current USSTRATCOM mission, operations, and challenge areas; able to articulate and recommend work shaping to ensure MITRE pursues high impact work for this CCMDDirect quality oversight and peer review processes for major deliverables of the ~12 STE projectFoster strategic and technical leadership as a trusted advisor to the J-Code Directors and USSTRATCOM senior leaders ensuring MITRE working the CCMD’s highest priorities and optimally delivering value to themIdentify operational or technical gaps in current NC2/NC3, EMS, and USSTRATCOM core mission systems; recommend mitigations for issues associated with fielded or new systems in developmentCollaborate closely with other MITRE project leaders (to include the NEC, and Service-related projects) to ensure congruence of enterprise-impacting deliverables and objectivesWork with N257 Chief Engineer to ensure quality work products are delivered to USSTRATCOMUse MITRE business and financial systems to plan, manage, execute, report staffing, delivery, costs, and financial status of the project/tasks on regular basis throughout the planning year and year of execution ensuring fully delivery off staffing and funding to the sponsorPartner with Department Manager and Chief Engineer to propose future year work program integrating sponsor needs and demands with broader MITRE corporate division, and department goalsServe as a key N257 department leader, coordinating closely with Department Manager, Chief Engineer, as well as other Project Leaders and Group Leaders, to ensure department/division objectives are considered and supported via the work on the project.

Basic Qualifications:

title: Analyst Asset Performance
description:
Imagine a future where you take on data and analytical challenges and support our largest portfolio in delivering high revenues

Join us in this role where you’ll be responsible for supporting the development of the tools used to analyze the performance of our region Americas operating assets (wind, solar and battery storage) through effective data management. This includes data analysis as well as visualizations, data blending, and data validations. You’ll need to support the design and implementation of indices, key metrics, and data models to identify performance improvement opportunities.

Welcome to Asset Performance

You’ll be part of Performance Analytics where you, together with your colleagues, will be responsible for translating data into meaningful performance metrics, reports, and analysis, ensuring valuable insights across our portfolio in region Americas. You’ll build and maintain relationships with site representatives, asset managers, data scientists, engineers, and external stakeholders supporting the strategic initiatives across the fleet when it comes to data analysis requests, internal and external reporting, anomaly detection and performance evaluations. As a team, we consist of six diverse and energetic individuals, with broad capabilities when it comes to the renewables industry and working with data and analytics.

You’ll play an important role in: 

utilizing and developing the existing data platform to facilitate analysis with focus on anomaly detections as well as monitoring the performance of assetsvalidating and developing reporting provided by suppliers in respect of contractual requirementsdeveloping, reporting, and managing implementation of new metrics, algorithms, and indicators for the assetstesting and implementing data sources used for all analysis and reporting, incl. availability and quality assessments of datarefining and optimizing processes in relation to internal and external reporting deliverables.

To succeed in the role, you: 

have a bachelor’s or master’s in engineering, business, economics, computer science, mathematics, statistics, or related technical fieldhave strong communication, presentation as well as analytical problem-solving skillshave a self-driven, motivated, and systematic approach to your work, delivering high-quality solutionsare proficient in Python, R, SQL, Microsoft Office software suite, Power BI, and Tableauquickly learn and understand data structures, software platforms, and performance metrics to gain insights from operational data

Maybe you’ve read the above and can see you have some transferable skills, even though they don’t quite match all the points. If you think you can bring something to the team, we still encourage you to apply.

Join a global leader in renewable energy

Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.

Shape the future with us

Send your application to us as soon as possible. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.

If you need to request any adjustments or accommodations to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.

Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.

title: CDL Shuttle Driver
description:

Why you will love Coca-Cola UNITED?

The Driver Shuttle RIF is a non touch freight position and is responsible for pulling finished goods from the production plant and raw materials from the warehouse to the plant.

What Your Day Will Look Like

title: Financial Advisor
description: Role: Associate Financial Advisor Compensation: $50,000-$80,000 depending on relevant experience, credentials, and past resultsFull Benefits: PTO, LTD/STD, Matching 401(k)Variable Compensation: individual and team bonuses; unlimited upside through structured career development pathway. Requirements:Bachelor’s degree2-5 years of relevant professional working experience.Life and Health Insurance License and Experience, Series 6/63 or Series 7 requiredBackground and Reference check completed prior to hireNon-solicitation agreement Description of Role: We are looking to add an Associate Financial Advisor that will begin their career with our firm in a support role to our Private Wealth Advisors.  Upon joining our team, the candidate will learn team processes and begin attending client meetings. Initial primary duties will include meeting summary notes, fulfilling service tasks themselves or assigning them to our established operations team and composing meeting follow ups. In addition, the service advisor is expected to become proficient in creating custom financial plans, developing asset allocation analyses, providing recommendations for rebalancing portfolios, advising on insurance and investment proposals, and overseeing special projects (such as: tax planning, insurance policy strategy, charitable giving, & pension analysis).  The service advisor must be comfortable working directly with clients (to answer routine questions and service requests) and work well in a team environment. They will be expected to identify thoughtful ways to enhance client loyalty by providing the client with an individualized experience, timely follow ups, and thoughtful touchpoints. They will work to provide a frictionless experience between the needs of the client and the operations of our team.  Success will be measured by how quickly they connect with current clients and how they help to cultivate existing client relationships and earn referrals for the firm. Some service advisors may choose to build a career solely within this role, but there will also be a structured pathway for those wishing to advance their career to become an established Private Wealth Advisor with business development capabilities. The evolution of this role is a pathway to becoming a partner in the firm. Coaching, career support and educational expenses (e.g. obtaining a Series 7 and CFP designation is a primary goal for all advisors) will be provided as one advances through the various stages of development.  About Catalyst Planning Partners:Our mission within Catalyst is to deliver sophisticated solutions in a straightforward manner to help our clients achieve financial security. We are a Catalyst for helping our clients to achieve financial security. Our ambition is to elevate our profession. We aim to re-define what it means to be a Trusted Financial Advisor. We are elevating our client’s expectations and continually discovering new ways to enhance our value proposition. We think bigger, expect more, and challenge ourselves, our team and our joint work partners to achieve new heights. Catalyst was established in 2017 with our two partners, Joe Smith & Rich Woo. Collectively, they have over 35 years of experience. Catalyst Planning Partners oversees approximately $500M in assets under management across 300 households. The team is currently comprised of: 3 Private Wealth Advisors 6 Operations Associates

title: Project Manager
description:
Adaptable. You are driven to provide exceptional customer service and high-quality finished products in the ever-changing world of custom designs/builds.

Diplomatic. You use emotional intelligence to communicate with respect and clarity to team members and clients alike.

Detail-oriented. You understand how small details impact the big picture and keep an eye on the right moving pieces to ensure each project stays on track.

Curious. You are eager to learn more about exhibits best practices and client content related to natural and cultural history.

Job Responsibilities

Client Relationships

Serve as the main point of contact for assigned clients through entire project lifecycle; project managers are working with 6-12 clients at any given time.

Builds relationships with clients and other key project stakeholders through clear, consistent communication in person, virtually, on the phone, and in written communication.

Educate clients on exhibits designs-builds process, as well as any required third-party partners and related processes, to ensure they feel comfortable and "in the loop" every step of the way.

Manage client expectations in regard to project schedule, budget, desin deliverables, and the world of custom fabricated exhibits components.

Facilitate client meetings, review, and approval of all designs deliverables, pre-production documents, and fabrication samples.

Keep client up to date on fabrication progress.

Walk through completed exhibist space with clients to identify any punch-list items; ensure all punch-list items are resolved in a timely manner.

Remain in contact with clients to resolve any issues that arise after project closeout.

Work plans

Create, execute, adapt, and close project work plans.

Develop and maintain project schedules, taking into consideration team member availability and competing project demands.

Prioritize tasks and develop schedules that reflect those priorities.

Follow SRS standard processes, including internal project management checklists.

Team management

Hold regular team meetings to ensure project stays on schedule, problems are resolved in a timely fashion, and team members are informed of any project updates.

Use knowledge of project context to drive team decisions and help team members structure and prioritize work.

Communicate project schedules and track team member progress toward deadlines.

Collaborate with other PMs to apply management best practices and process improvement on an ongoing basis.

Identify capacity issues and strategize solutions with SRS management.

Project admin

Administer and maintain project contracts.

Work with accounting department to invoice clients for designs deliverables and fabricated components.

Create, track, and ensure change-orders are presented and processed in a timely fashion.

Establish meeting agendas and create meeting notes with action items and due dates as follow-up.

Manage specialty vendor agreements and hold vendors accountable for scope of work delivered on time and within budget.

SRS representative

Develop understanding of and comfort with SRS designs/builds process.

Communicate SRS designs/builds process to clients on an ongoing basis.

Represent SRS to clients, prospective clients, subcontractors, and partners with passion and professionalism.

Additional Skills

Expertise with the Office and Google suites

Familiarity with fabrication methods and construction drawings preferred

PMP preferred

Travel Requirements

Project Managers travel to project sites as needed for kickoff meetings and designs presentations (typically 1-2 days) and exhibits installations (typically 3-5 days), averaging 1 trip every 1-2 months. This can include travel by car or plane throughout the United States; international travel may occasionally be required.

Travel is confirmed and communicated as far in advance as possible. Project Manager schedules are taken into consideration when planning projects and travel dates.

How To Apply

Upload a pdf including your letter of interest* and your resume.

Respond to at least 2 of these questions

Tell us how your experience to date applies to the responsibilities of this role.

What makes you an effective project manager, particularly for a designs/builds team?

Share a story of your success in accomplishing desired outcomes for a particularly challenging project.

We look forward to getting to know you!

title: Accounts Payable Coordinator
description:

Review proper approval authorizations to pass for payment. Review invoice pricing charged against purchase orders, verbal quotes, and/or committed pricing. Support other divisions to ensure accuracy within the invoicing process along with responsibility for the month-end closing for all divisions.

Prepare and file Form

1096 and Form 1099's annually.

title: Senior Clinical Development Scientist, Ophthalmology
description:
Location: Remote - U.S. Based Pay Rate: $150,000-$170,000 - Depending on ExperienceExperience: 5+years of experience in biotech/pharma/CRO industry 
Top 5 Requirements: Experience: A minimum of 5 years in the biotech/pharma/CRO industry.Advanced Degree: An MD, OD, PhD, PharmD, or equivalent qualification.Document Authorship: Proficiency in creating essential clinical study documents, including protocols, ICFs, IBs, CSRs, and CRFs, while adhering to company SOPs.Ophthalmology Alignment: Education aligned with ophthalmology or substantial exposure to ophthalmology clinical development. Clinical Drug Development: Preferred but not obligatory.
Purpose of the role:The Clinical Development Scientist / Clinical Program Lead will be a key member of the Clinical Development team and will partner with cross-functional teams in the design and execution of clinical studies. They will support the physician Director of Clinical Development with efficient execution of deliverables by supporting the planning, conduct, analysis and reporting of clinical studies Phase (1-111) across various therapeutic areas within ophthalmology.The successful candidate will work independently under the guidance of the Director of Clinical Development Ophthalmology and in collaboration with relevant internal stakeholders to achieve corporate objectives with a focus on upholding quality, integrity, and leveraging strong cross-functional partnerships while complying with company SOPs. They will work closely and effectively with Clinical Operations in the overall conduct and timely execution of clinical trials. Internally, they will support and manage preparation of clinical study documents, perform medical monitoring, attend SIVs, prepare content for advisory boards, perform due diligence for business development opportunities and enthusiastically support cross-functional partners as relevant. Externally, they will work with vendors, consultants, and SMEs for clinical development related activities such as organizing advisory boards, roundtables, and document preparation and submission. 5-10% travel may be expected.
Key Responsibilities of the role:Assisting the clinical development physician in the preparation of clinical study related documents (may be several studies in parallel) including protocols, IBS, CSRs, CRFs, ICFs, and meeting presentations in compliance with company SOPs where applicable.Coordinate with internal stakeholders (i.e., operations, regulatory, biostatistics, pharmacology/toxicology, QA) to facilitate efficient execution of clinical studies.Assisting in the implementation of protocols and interactions with vendors and CROs, engaging with relevant external stakeholders.Medical monitoring under the guidance of the Director of Clinical Development Ophthalmology and in close partnership with Clinical Operations.Supporting Data Management in the building of the CRF for clinical studies.Prepare presentations for meetings such as scientific advisory boards, investigator meetings, and internal study progress updates.Assist in the preparation and/or review of posters or presentations for external presentation.Assist in the development of clinical trial data collection in the EDC system and Case Report forms (CRFs).Performing literature searches for clinical development activities and due diligence of business development opportunities with the ability to distill key information.Able to work independently, responsibly, and collaboratively as part of a lean matrix environment.Demonstrate flexibility to meet deadlines and to respond to frequent and/or unexpected changes.Manage external vendors supporting clinical development activities, providing clear direction and ensuring timely completion of key deliverables.Keep abreast of the therapeutic area landscape with respect to treatment paradigms, preclinical advancements, and competitive intelligence.
Education:An advanced degree in life sciences (MD, OD, PhD, PharmD or equivalent) is required.Minimum of 5 years research experience in academic, hospital, CRO or industry setting.Ophthalmology experience is required. Clinical drug development experience is preferred but not required.

title: Multiple Shifts - Inventory Control Specialist - (MON-THUR)
description:
Dorman was founded on the belief that people should have greater freedom to fix motor vehicles. For over 100 years, we have been driving new solutions, releasing tens of thousands of aftermarket replacement products engineered to save time and money, and increase convenience and reliability. Founded and headquartered in the United States, we are a pioneering global organization offering an always-evolving catalog of automotive, heavy-duty and specialty vehicle products. Today, we have more than 3,500 employees across 28 different locations, with a family of brands that also includes SuperATV and Dayton Parts. Publicly traded under the stock ticker DORM, we had revenues surpassing $1.7 billion in 2022 and over $3.5 billion in enterprise value.

Everyone who works at Dorman is called a Contributor. We need everyone, regardless of role and experience, to contribute to our success. That means everyone has a unique ability to make an impact on the business. We encourage all our Contributors to bring their authentic selves to work. The freedom to pursue new ideas, offer different perspectives, and grow in your career is fundamental to working at Dorman.

 Summary  : Perform audits, and physically count product locations.

 Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following  . Other duties may be assigned as needed.

 Research, report, and root cause discrepancies  Prepare and comprehend QAD reports  Verify inventory quantities and locations  Use of radio frequency hand held or truck mount scanning device  Perform department audits  Use of QAD and RF  Operate motorized industrial equipment  Participate in department meetings and projects  Operate within standard operating procedures  Maintain neat, clean and well-organized work area  Timely, regular and dependable attendance 


Supervisor Responsibilities

This job has no supervisory responsibilities

 Qualifications  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

 Excellent math ability  Excellent problem-solving skills  Analytical, responsible, and conscientious  Good performance, accuracy, and safety records – no active warnings in file  Ability to lift, pack and stack up to 50 pounds in proper manner  Willing to work overtime as required  Adhere to all safety standards and personal protective equipment (PPE) guidelines  Ability to follow verbal and written instructions  Ability to pass the motorized industrial equipment test and obtain license  Working knowledge of QAD system preferred; ability & willingness to be trained to proficiency  Working knowledge of Microsoft Office  Great communication skills  Experience working in a warehouse environment helpful but not necessary  Legible handwriting 


Education And/or Experience

High school diploma or general education degree (GED).

Language Skills

Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos. Ability to write simple correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization.

Mathematical Skills

Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent.

 Reasoning Ability 

Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.

 Certificates, Licenses, Registrations 

Must successfully complete the motorized industrial equipment test and obtain license.

 Physical Demands 

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; bend; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; talk and hear. title: Manager Supply Planning
description:

Responsible for production planning, issuing forecasts and purchase orders to contract manufacturing sites, following up on orders to target on time delivery, support production requirements and inventory targets. Ensure no stock-outs of Acadia commercial productsIssue, track and maintain Purchase Orders (PO's) to Contract Manufacturing Organizations (CMO’s) for the procurement / manufacturing of product(s) required to support target inventory levelsPerform receipts and any required inventory transactions in ERP systemsOversee product planning (PP) systems and activitiesDevelop and produce planning metrics for management reviewAssess supply chain robustness through various scenario analysis activitiesCoordinate with Finance in managing cost of goodsIdentifies, communicates, and elevates supply chain problems to avert supply issuesDrive and optimize processes and procedures to support growth and complexity of Acadia supply planning

Strong knowledge of ERP software systems and procedures and with robust production planningExperience with maintaining and ensuring adequate stocks of drug product, active pharmaceutical ingredients (API) and key raw materials.Experience with cold chain products and subsequent supply chainIn depth knowledge of GMP principles, concepts andStrong analytical and computer skills Proficient in Excel and PowerPoint.Knowledge and experience engaging in CMO contract relationships and planningStrong negotiating skills and problem solving abilitiesStrong organizational and documentationAbility to manage change in a dynamicAbility to change the thinking of, or gain acceptance from, others in sensitive situations, without damage to the relationship.Skill at supporting a team environment that supports a common vision and ability to work cross functionally within multi-departmental teams within and without the organization.Proficiency at effectively prioritizing goals, assessing team capability, and coordinating resources to achieve those goals.Ability to travel 10% of the time both domestically and internationally.

title: Director of Business Analytics (Go-To-Market Team) - Hybrid / Atlanta, GA
description:
Experity is the leading software and services company for on-demand healthcare in the U.S. We provide software solutions that remove complexities and simplify operations for 5700+ urgent care clinics across the country. We create, maintain, and support products to facilitate the complete on-demand healthcare experience: from patients finding clinics and making appointments, to checking in, to clinical documentation, and to the final bill paid by the patient. Our team is committed to changing healthcare for the better by innovating and revolutionizing on-demand healthcare for millions of patients across the country.

Experity offers the following:

Benefits – Comprehensive coverage starts first day of employment and includes Medical, Dental/Orthodontia, and Vision.Ownership - All Team Members are eligible for synthetic ownership in Experity upon one year of employment with real financial rewards when the company is successful!Employee Assistance Program - This robust program includes counseling, legal resolution, financial education, pet adoption assistance, identity theft and fraud resolution, and so much more.Flexibility – Experity is committed to helping team members face the demands of juggling work, family and life-related issues by offering flexible work scheduling to manage your work-life balance.Paid Time Off (PTO) - Experity offers a generous PTO plan and increases with milestones to ensure our Team Members have time to recharge, relax, and spend time with loved ones.Career Development – Experity maintains a learning program foundation for the company that allows Team Members to explore their potential and achieve their career goals.Team Building – We bring our Team Members together when we can to strengthen the team, build relationships, and have fun! We even have a family company picnic and a holiday party.Total Compensation - Competitive pay, quarterly bonuses and a 401(k) retirement plan with an employer match to help you save for your future and ensure that you can retire with financial security.

Job Summary: 

With a robust mix of data science and consulting skills, this role plays a pivotal part in driving data-driven strategic and tactical decision-making across the organization by focusing on industry trends, customer insights, revenue optimization, and go-to-market strategies. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of the healthcare industry and will work closely with go-to-market leaders in marketing, sales, customer success, support, and product to ensure our strategies are aligned and informed by data.

Responsibilities:

Responsibilities: 

Data Analysis and Reporting:Conduct comprehensive data analysis pertaining to market trends, customer behavior, and technology trends within the healthcare sector.Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that provide insights into industry dynamics, revenue streams, and go-to-market effectiveness.Strategic Consulting:Utilize data insights to offer strategic recommendations to go-to-market teams, enhancing marketing, sales, and customer engagement strategies.Provide consulting support to internal stakeholders, helping interpret data and translating it into actionable business strategies.Collaboration and Leadership:Work closely with leaders across marketing, sales, customer success, and support to implement data-driven approaches for market penetration and customer engagement.Lead cross-functional projects that aim to improve operational efficiencies and drive revenue growth through data insights.Market and Competitive Intelligence:Monitor healthcare industry trends, regulatory changes, and competitive landscapes to inform strategic planning.Analyze customer segments and market opportunities to advise on go-to-market strategies and product positioning.Revenue and Performance Optimization:Identify revenue opportunities and efficiency improvements through data analysis, predictive modeling, and business case development.Collaborate with finance and operations teams to align revenue targets, forecasting, and performance metrics.
Education and Experience: 

Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, or a related field or equivalent combination of education and experience .5+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a consulting role.Proficiency in data analytics tools (e.g., SQL, Python, R) and BI platforms (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).Demonstrated ability to translate complex data sets into actionable insights.Strong consulting and project management skills, with the ability to lead cross-functional initiatives.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of working closely with leadership and stakeholders across functions.

Preferred: 

Master’s degree or advanced certification in Business Analytics, Data Science, or related field.Deep understanding of the healthcare industry, including regulatory environments, market dynamics, and customer needs.Experience in go-to-market strategy development and execution in a healthcare context.

Budgeted salary range:

$121,000 to $170,000

Manager Competencies:

Contributes to the creation of the departmental strategy in alignment with the organization's goals and objectives.Oversees the day-to-day operations of the department.Manages the overall operational, budgetary and financial responsibilities of the department.Plans, evaluates and improves the efficiency of business processes and procedures to enhance overall effectiveness.Provides oversight and direction to employees, providing frequent and timely feedbackCoach, mentor and develop staff, including providing development planning and opportunities.Manage performance deficiencies in a timely and clear manner, taking disciplinary action when necessary.Review performance data to monitor and measure department productivity, goals achievement and overall effectiveness.Responsible for anticipating and planning appropriate staffing levels.Consciously creates a workplace culture that is consistent with the organization's core values.

Every team member exhibits our core values:

Team FirstLift Others UpShare OpenlySet and Crush GoalsDelight the Client

Our urgent care solutions include:

Electronic Medical Records (EMR): Software that healthcare providers use to input patient data, such as medical history, diagnoses, treatment plans, medications, and test results.Patient Engagement (PE): Software that shows patients the wait times at various clinics, allows patients to reserve a spot in line if there's a wait, and book the appointment.Practice Management (PM): Software that the clinic front desk staff uses to register the patient once they arrive for their appointment.Billing and Revenue Cycle Management (RCM): Software that manages coding, billing and payer contracts for clinics so they don’t have to.Teleradiology: Board certified radiologist providing accurate and timely reads of results from X-rays, CT scans, MRIs, and ultrasounds, for our urgent care clients.Consulting: Consulting services for urgent care clinics to assist with opening, expanding and enhancing client's businesses

description:

They will lead teams to optimized efficiency, drive growth, and ensure the company's competitiveness in the transportation industry.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.

title: Vice President of Finance - Gulf Winds Credit Union
description: Position SummaryGulf Winds Credit Union is in search of a Vice President of Finance/Controller to join their team. As a member of the Senior Leadership Team, this role will oversee Accounting and Finance Departmental functions. This position will compile and analyze the credit union’s financial performance relative to budget and historical benchmarks, provide recommendation to management for achieving strategic objectives, and has investment authority. Other responsibilities include operation of the Financial Information System, including Core Accounting System, Financial Management System, and process automation workflows; developing reports proactively and presenting insights to executive management; planning, directing, and maintaining ALM reporting, liquidity programs, forecasting, budgeting, and organizational profitability. A Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or Economics with at least 5 year’s similar or related ALM experience is required, Master’s preferred. A minimum of 7 years of experience in financial institution accounting, forecasting, and financial analysis along with a working knowledge of GAAP and NCUA regulations and reporting is required. Experience with auditors and/or examiners is required, experience with Axiom financial suite preferred.Company ProfileGulf Winds Credit Union was organized in 1954 as Chemstrand Employees Credit Union. Since the beginning, Gulf Winds has focused on helping members with their financial goals, by caring about the things that matter most to their members. Gulf Winds’ focus is on finding the banking solutions that empowers their members to build the best financial life possible. Today, Gulf Winds Credit Union, with assets exceeding $1.1 Billion and over 80,000 members, serves over 75 counties in Florida, Alabama, and Georgia. At Gulf Winds Credit Union, we value integrity, care, growth, and innovation. We are part of the community we serve, and we work to help our members achieve their financial goals. Home to the renowned “Blue Angels,” and the Naval Air Station, Pensacola has a proud military heritage. Offering 50-plus miles of coastline, Pensacola‘s temperate climate and friendly community presents a wonderful quality of life. With more than 40 primary and secondary schools boasting excellent standardized test scores, award winning area hospitals that rank among the best in the state, Pensacola is a great place to learn, grow, work, and play.Compensation An excellent competitive compensation package will be offered to the selected candidate.Application ProcedureTo submit your confidential application and learn more about the positions represented by D.
